lexa.core.data.io

Class DataReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.data.io.DataReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, ReadDataSet

    public class DataReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReadDataSet
    Read DataItem and DataSet objects from an input stream.

    A lexa.core.data.DataSet is read as a series of lexa.core.data.DataItem objects.

    A lexa.core.data.DataItem is read as the name followed by the formatted value; with the toString depends on the data type.

    See DataWriter for the toString used.

    Since:
    2013-02
    Author:
    William

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException

        Specified by:

      • read

        private DataSet read(boolean isNested)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Read a DataSet from the input.
        Parameters:
        isNested - Indicate that the read is inside a DataSet and so should not reach EOF.
        Returns:
        A DataSet read from the input, null if empty and isNested == true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurs reading the input.

      • readItem

        private DataItem readItem(boolean isNested)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Read a DataItem from the input.
        Parameters:
        isNested - Indicate that the read is inside a DataSet and so should not reach EOF.
        Returns:
        A {see ArrayDataItem} read from the input or null if The current DataSet has all been read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurs reading the input.

      • readCodedString

        private java.lang.String readCodedString()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Read a coded string from the input.

        Example: 

         \# this will all be read as\
 it \@ contains all the special chracters such as \\ are escaped\
 \{ so the parser can read them \}.\
 all for \$15.00 \@ \-50\% discount
        Returns:
        A decoded string.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurs reading the input.

      • readDataFile

        public static DataSet readDataFile(java.io.File file)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Read an entire data file into a DataSet.
        This provides a single line method call to open a data file, read all its content and close it cleanly.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be read
        Returns:
        the content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - when a problem is encountered reading from the file.
